snippet: Under a government-funded program denounced by conservative politicians, the city of tolerance is giving alcoholics street-cleaning jobs and paying them partly in beer.
abstract: Unusual government-funded program in Amsterdam lures alcoholics off the street by giving them street-cleaning jobs and paying them partly in beer; program, started in 2012 by Rainbow Foundation, has been denounced by conservative politicians but praised by other officials and residents, who argue it is better to give alcoholics something to do and restrict their drinking to limited amount of beer.
lead_paragraph: Under a government-funded program denounced by conservative politicians, the city of tolerance is giving alcoholics street-cleaning jobs and paying them partly in beer.

headline.main: Amsterdam Has a Deal for Alcoholics: Work Paid in Beer
headline.print_headline: A City of Tolerance Has a Deal for Alcoholics: Work Paid in Beer
